episodeTitle: Shaking Fish-Man Island! A Celestial Dragon Drifts In!
episodeTitleJapanese: 揺れる魚人島！漂着した天竜人
description: Following Jinbe's acceptance as a Shichibukai, the Sun Pirates return to Fish-Man Island. When World Noble Mjosgard arrives on a wrecked ship, tensions rise as former slaves attempt to kill him. Queen Otohime intervenes to save him despite the danger, and when Mjosgard takes her hostage, young Shirahoshi's terrified scream summons five Sea Kings, revealing her legendary power for the first time.

events.title: Sun Pirates Return to Fish-Man Island After Jinbe Becomes Shichibukai
events.description: Following Jinbe's acceptance as a Warlord of the Sea, the Sun Pirates officially disband and return to Fish-Man Island as free citizens. This marks the end of their pirate activities as Jinbe's new status provides amnesty for the crew's former crimes.
events.significance: Jinbe's acceptance as a Shichibukai grants freedom to the former slaves of the Sun Pirates, allowing them to live peacefully on Fish-Man Island. This is a major step toward Otohime's dream of peace and coexistence.

events.title: Donquixote Mjosgard Arrives at Fish-Man Island
events.description: World Noble Donquixote Mjosgard crashes on Fish-Man Island on a destroyed ship, the sole survivor of his journey. He arrogantly demands help while shooting at the citizens and demands his former slaves return to servitude.
events.significance: Mjosgard's arrival creates a major crisis on Fish-Man Island, testing Otohime's philosophy of peace and forgiveness. This introduces a character who will later undergo a profound transformation.

quotes.text: Bring me a mask and a doctor immediately! You fish should be grateful a World Noble graces your pathetic island!
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Mjosgard
quotes.context: Mjosgard's arrogant demands upon arriving at Fish-Man Island

events.title: Former Sun Pirates Slaves Confront Their Tormentor
events.description: Former slaves of the Sun Pirates, who suffered horrific abuse under the Celestial Dragons, recognize Mjosgard as a World Noble. Flashbacks reveal their torture and suffering. They gather around Mjosgard with weapons, their trauma and rage overwhelming their reason.
events.significance: This moment powerfully illustrates the deep trauma inflicted by the World Nobles and the cycle of hatred that Otohime is trying to break. It shows why reconciliation seems impossible and makes Otohime's intervention all the more courageous.

events.title: Otohime Saves Mjosgard from Assassination
events.description: As former slaves shoot at Mjosgard in revenge, Queen Otohime throws herself in front of him, shielding him with her body. A bullet grazes her ribs, wounding her, but she saves the World Noble's life. She begs her people not to pass hatred to their children.
events.significance: This is the defining moment of Otohime's character - risking her life to save her people's oppressor to break the cycle of hatred. Her words about not passing hatred to children encapsulate her entire philosophy and mission for Fish-Man Island.

quotes.text: I understand your pain! I can feel it! But we cannot let our hatred and resentment be passed on to the children! If we do, it will never end!
quotes.speaker: Otohime
quotes.context: Otohime pleading with the former slaves not to kill Mjosgard

events.title: Mjosgard Takes Otohime Hostage
events.description: After regaining consciousness, Mjosgard shows no gratitude for being saved. Instead, he holds Otohime hostage at gunpoint, declaring that even though she is a queen, she is still inferior to him as a World Noble. He demands a doctor and threatens to kill her.
events.significance: This moment shows how deeply ingrained the arrogance and cruelty of the Celestial Dragons is, making Mjosgard's later redemption even more remarkable. It also demonstrates Otohime's unwavering commitment to peace despite being threatened.

quotes.text: Even if you're a queen, you're still just a fish! You're all beneath me!
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Mjosgard
quotes.context: Mjosgard holding Otohime hostage after she saved his life

events.title: Shirahoshi Summons Sea Kings for the First Time
events.description: When young Shirahoshi sees her mother in danger, she screams in terror. Her cry summons five massive Sea Kings that emerge near Fish-Man Island, shocking everyone present. This is the first manifestation of Shirahoshi's power as the Ancient Weapon Poseidon.
events.significance: This is one of the most important reveals in the series - Shirahoshi is the Ancient Weapon Poseidon, capable of commanding Sea Kings. This power will prove crucial to the series' endgame and explains why Vander Decken has been pursuing her.

events.title: Vander Decken IX Realizes Shirahoshi is the Legendary Mermaid Princess
events.description: Witnessing Shirahoshi summon the Sea Kings, Vander Decken IX realizes she is the legendary mermaid princess who can control Sea Kings - the very being his ancestor, the first Vander Decken, spent his entire life searching for.
events.significance: This revelation explains Vander Decken IX's obsessive pursuit of Shirahoshi and sets up his role as an antagonist in the present-day Fish-Man Island arc. It connects the ancient legend to current events.

quotes.text: So she's the one... The mermaid princess who can command the Sea Kings! The legend my ancestor searched for his entire life!
quotes.speaker: Vander Decken IX
quotes.context: Decken realizing Shirahoshi's true nature as Poseidon

events.title: Hody Jones Witnesses the Power of the Ancient Weapon
events.description: Hody Jones, watching from afar, witnesses Shirahoshi's power to summon Sea Kings. This knowledge will later factor into his plans to use Shirahoshi and the Ancient Weapon for his own purposes.
events.significance: This moment plants the seeds for Hody's later schemes involving Shirahoshi and shows how different characters react to the same revelation with different intentions.

events.title: Mjosgard Faints from Fear of the Sea Kings
events.description: The appearance of the massive Sea Kings terrifies Mjosgard so much that he faints from fear. This removes the immediate threat to Otohime and allows the situation to de-escalate.
events.significance: This moment of vulnerability in Mjosgard is the first crack in his arrogant facade, setting the stage for his eventual transformation through Otohime's influence.

events.title: Otohime Decides to Accompany Mjosgard to the Surface
events.description: After Mjosgard is healed by Aladine, Otohime makes the bold decision to accompany him back to the surface world. She sees this as an opportunity to prove that humans and fish-men can coexist peacefully and to negotiate directly with the World Nobles.
events.significance: This decision represents Otohime's ultimate act of faith in her dream of coexistence. It's a dangerous journey that will lead to major developments in her campaign for peace, though it will also set up the tragedy to come.

quotes.text: I will go to the surface with him. This is our chance to show that we can live together in peace!
quotes.speaker: Otohime
quotes.context: Otohime announcing her decision to travel to Mary Geoise with Mjosgard

themes.description: The episode explores how trauma and hatred can be passed from generation to generation, and Otohime's determination to break this cycle by showing mercy even to her people's oppressor.
themes.symbolism: Otohime shielding Mjosgard with her body symbolizes using one's own sacrifice to protect future generations from inheriting hatred.
culturalReferences: The episode deals with themes of intergenerational trauma similar to real-world issues of historical oppression and reconciliation.

themes.description: Otohime's decision to save and help Mjosgard despite his cruelty demonstrates the transformative power of forgiveness and compassion.
themes.symbolism: The World Noble being saved by a fish-man represents the possibility of redemption even for those who seem beyond saving.

themes.description: Shirahoshi's unconscious summoning of the Sea Kings reveals that ancient powers and prophecies are awakening, connecting the past to the present.
themes.symbolism: The Sea Kings responding to Shirahoshi's cry represents how destiny and inherited power manifest in moments of emotional crisis.
culturalReferences: References to ancient weapons and prophecies draw on various mythological traditions of legendary powers awakening in times of need.

characterSpotlights.development: Otohime's character reaches its moral peak as she risks her life to save her people's oppressor, demonstrating the ultimate expression of her pacifist philosophy. Her decision to accompany Mjosgard to the surface shows her unwavering commitment to peace.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded on the flashbacks of the Sun Pirates' time as slaves, showing more graphic depictions of their suffering under the Celestial Dragons.
Additional reaction shots of various Fish-Man Island citizens watching the confrontation were added for dramatic effect.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapters 624-625 of the manga, continuing the Fish-Man Island flashback arc.
Donquixote Mjosgard would not appear again in the anime until Episode 886, over 340 episodes later, where his character transformation is complete.
This is the first time in the series that Shirahoshi's power as Poseidon is shown, though it won't be explicitly confirmed until later in the arc.
The episode aired on April 29, 2012 in Japan, during the height of the Fish-Man Island arc's exploration of themes of discrimination and reconciliation.
Tetsuo Gotō voiced Mjosgard in his initial appearances, but was later replaced by Masami Kikuchi from Episode 886 onward.
